ARABIC: إِلَّا ٱلْمُسْتَضْعَفِينَ مِنَ ٱلرِّجَالِ وَٱلنِّسَآءِ وَٱلْوِلْدَٰنِ لَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ حِيلَةً وَلَا يَهْتَدُونَ سَبِيلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Except for those men, women and children who really are oppressed and do not have any other possibility and are not guided to any way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But those who are helpless, men, women and children, who can neither contrive a plan nor do they know the way,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: except the men, women, and children who were indeed too feeble to be able to seek the means of escape and did not know where to go.-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: As for the really weak and oppressed men, women, and children who were not able to find any means of obtaining their freedom or of having the right guidance,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Except those who were forcibly subdued among men, and the women and children, unable to devise a plan and unaware of the way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Except the weak ones among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan, nor are they able to direct their way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Except the weak from among the men and the children who have not in their power the means nor can they find a way (to escape);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: except the men, women, and children who, being abased, can devise nothing and are not guided to a way;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Except the feeble among men, and the women, and the children, who are unable to devise a plan and are not shown a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: except such weak ones among men, women and children, as are incapable of adopting any plan or of finding any way out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Excepting the weak ones among men, women and children, unable to find a stratagem and not guided to a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Except the oppressed among men, women and children, who have neither access to any means nor are guided to any way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Except those who are (really) weak and oppressed - men, women, and children - who have no means in their power, nor (a guide-post) to their way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Except the weak ones among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan, nor are they able to direct their way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Except the men, women, and children, who, being abased have no means and they are unable to guide themselves to a way.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Except for the weak among men, and women, and children who have no means to act, and no means to find a way out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Except for the oppressed among men, women and children who cannot devise a plan nor are they directed to a way -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [4:98] Except the oppressed among the men, women, and children who are unable to devise a plan, having no strength to emigrate and no substance, and are not guided to a way, a means [of going] to the land of emigration.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah then showed who had an excuse, saying: (Except the feeble among men) the elderly and the weak, (and the women, and the children, who are unable to devise a plan) for leaving Mecca (and are not shown a way) they do not know how to leave.
